thread.title: Texas quotable: 'We don't know how to compete'
thread.title_full: Texas quotable: 'We don't know how to compete' | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: Texas quotable: 'We don't know how to compete'
text:
Fort Worth - The Longhorns suffered their second blowout loss of the season Saturday. Texas lost 50-7 to TCU after a mistake ridden first half.
"I felt (the players) were ready, just by the way they worked all week," head coach Charlie Strong said. "I thought when the game first started off, we were going to be in good shape. We knew this was a good (TCU) team. We knew this is the No. 4 team in the country. But still, though, that should not stop us from going out and playing our best."
Strong on the loss
"We came out today and just didn't play hard. Just simple fundamental techniques ... we're looking for more leadership. We need to do a better job of coaching and we've got to get this turned around. We have no choice."
Strong on his message to the team
"I told them, 'we're not going to give up and we're not going to give in. We have to learn how to compete.' We don't know how to compete yet. There's something about pride - pride in yourself ... You have to know when things aren't going right, that some has to step up. That's just not what we're getting right now."
Redshirt freshman quarterback Jerrod Heard on the offense
"There's a lot we need to get done as far as offense. But we can't get down right now."
Sophomore running back D'Onta Foreman on Saturday's mistakes
"We have to clean up or mistakes. As a team, we just got to come together and figure out why we made mistakes."
Senior linebacker Peter Jinkens on the team's belief in Strong
"We still believe in him. He's a great coach and a great man. All we got to do is rally behind him."
TCU 50, Texas 7: Complete coverage
